request_pathways.name: Fax submission to Health Information Management
Mail to Barnes-Jewish Hospital HIM department

forms.document_type: Patient access request form (individual self-access under HIPAA § 164.524)
Authorization for release of information (third-party disclosure)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a dedicated one-page access request form from the Medical Records Requests page, fills it by hand, and submits via fax or mail.

red_flags: Requests full Social Security Number (with last-4-digits alternative offered)
bright_spots: Dedicated patient access form separate from third-party release authorization
Electronic delivery option via email explicitly offered on the form
Abstract checkbox bundles all starred record types into one selection
Single-page concise design minimizes patient burden

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available with minimal effort — the Medical Records Requests page is clearly organized under Patients & Visitors, with direct PDF links and no login required.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds; fax submission available — the form has a text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite; fax provides an electronic submission path.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — single-page layout with logical flow and plain language, but the electronic delivery caveat ('if possible') and lack of a fee schedule are minor gaps.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Process designed around patient self-access as a first-class use case — the org provides a dedicated patient access form with right-of-access framing, clearly distinct from the third-party authorization form.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no notarization or witness required, cost-based fee language aligns with HIPAA, 30-day timeline stated; the full SSN request is the only notable concern.

overall.summary: Barnes-Jewish Hospital exemplifies patient-centered access pathway design with a dedicated self-access form and clear website organization, but the lack of fillable PDF fields prevents a fully digital workflow.
